sense.name: a specific required task, given by a superior, e.g., instructor
sense.examples: The TA has not graded last week's assignment yet. The lieutenant gave his commandos a very dangerous assignment. Mary goes over her son's homework assignments every night.

sense.name: the legal transfer of an asset from one person to another
sense.examples: It was an assignment of leasehold property. The assignment of the railroad's holdings to the creditors was very complicated.

sense.name: associating one thing with another, attribution of belonging
sense.examples: The assignment of different values to these variables will result in different answers to the equations. The assignment of a home room to each student was accomplished on the first day of school. The assignment of the right name to this new product is very important.

sense.name: a legal document, a deed of conveyance
sense.examples: The lawyer went over the wording in the estate assignment.

sense.name: the location of a task, its site of execution
sense.examples: Our news anchor is on assignment this week in Paris. Her assignment was to the County Court.

sense.name: an appointment to a non-elected job or position
sense.examples: These assignments are political appointments by the governor. We are celebrating Tom's assignment as chief resident at the hospital.
